intro: Spiesia kansuensis, commonly known as the Kansu spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Spiesia kansuensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
